verse: (For the one directing. With stringed instruments. Al HaSheminit. Mizmor Dovid) Hashem, rebuke me not in Thine anger, neither chasten me in Thy hot displeasure.
Have mercy upon me, Hashem; for I am weak: Hashem, heal me; for my atzmot are shaking.
My nefesh is also much shaken; but Thou, Hashem, ad mosai (how much longer)?
Turn, Hashem, deliver my nefesh; hoshieini (save me) for the sake of Thy chesed.
For in mavet there is no remembrance of Thee; in Sheol who shall give Thee thanks?
I am weary with my groaning; all the lailah flood I my mittah with weeping; I water my couch with my tears.
Mine eye is consumed because of kaâ€™as (grief); it groweth old because of all mine enemies.
Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for Hashem hath heard the voice of my weeping.
Hashem hath heard my techinnah (supplication); Hashem will receive my tefillah (prayer).
Let all mine oyevim be ashamed and much troubled; let them turn back and suddenly be ashamed.
